#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Write Birthday Cards
#Text=Birthday cards are a wonderful way to let someone know that you are thinking of them on their birthday .
#Text=Start with “ Happy Birthday ” and then add a few heartfelt and sincere sentences .
#Text=Take the opportunity to share well wishes , kind words , funny memories , or maybe even a pun with the person .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Writing Kind Words
#Text=Wish them well for the year to come .
#Text=Birthday cards are a great chance to wish someone the best for the future .
#Text=This is a great option for both close family and friends , and acquaintances .
#Text=For example , “ All the best for the year to come ” or “ Wishing you a wonderful year full of great memories . ”
#Text=Share what you love or appreciate about the recipient .
#Text=This is a great way to make the card personal and sincere .
#Text=Include traits that you love about the person and ways that they inspire you .
#Text=Try to be as specific as you can , as this helps the card to feel more thoughtful .
#Text=For example , “ You are such a kind , generous , inspiring , and fun Mum ” or “ You are a wonderful friend and partner to me .
#Text=I am inspired by the way that you love so selflessly . ”
#Text=Celebrate the year that they ’ve had .
#Text=Birthdays are a great chance to look back and reflect on the year that has passed .
#Text=Celebrate any major achievements or milestones of the person , such as engagements , weddings , graduations , new jobs , or the birth of a child .
#Text=For example , “ Congratulations on graduating from college this year .
#Text=All the best for your new career . ”
#Text=If the person has had a hard year , include something like “ Congratulations on making it through a tough year . ”
#Text=Tell them how they make your life better .
#Text=This is a wonderful way to make the person feel celebrated .
#Text=Write a sentence or two about the ways that the recipient of the card adds value to your life .
#Text=This is particularly meaningful for a partner , close friends , or family member .
#Text=For your partner you could write , “ Thanks for making my life more fun , exciting , and joyful .
#Text=You make my life so rich . ”
#Text=Share a happy memory that you shared together .
#Text=Good memories are wonderful to reflect on .
#Text=Think about some of your favourite moments that you have shared and then write a short note reminiscing that memory .
#Text=For example , “ I really treasure all the memories of our shared holidays at the beach . ”
#Text=This is best for someone that you know well .
#Text=Express your love in the card if you are giving it to your significant other .
#Text=Take the opportunity to write a meaningful message about how much you love them and how your love for them grows each year .
#Text=Include specific things you love about them to make the note more personal .
#Text=For example , “ I love you to the moon and back .
#Text=My love for you increases every year .
#Text=I ’m so grateful to have such a kind , giving , and thoughtful partner . ”
#Text=Write in a kind and formal tone if the card is for a co-worker .
#Text=Let your relationship with the recipient dictate how you write the card .
#Text=If you have a professional working relationship with the person , use traditional birthday wishes , such as “ Wishing you a happy birthday and a wonderful year to come . ”
#Text=” Warm wishes ” or “ Best ” are appropriate formal ways to sign off a card to a co-worker .
#Text=Including Humour
#Text=Make a light-hearted joke about their age .
#Text=The most common birthday jokes tend to be about getting old .
#Text=For example , you could write “ another year closer to receiving your seniors discount ” or “ Happy 20th !
#Text=You ’re halfway to 40 ! ”
#Text=Avoid mentioning the person 's age if you know they are sensitive about it .
#Text=Also , try to stay away from jokes about death , as this will make some people uncomfortable .
#Text=Share a funny memory that you and the recipient have together .
#Text=This is a great way to add a personal touch to the card .
#Text=Mention any funny personal jokes that you share or any amusing memories .
#Text=For example , “ Remember we dressed up as giraffes at Steve ’s jungle party .
#Text=I often look back and laugh at that memory ! ”
#Text=Write a funny pun .
#Text=Think about the recipient 's interests and write a relevant pun .
#Text=For example , if the person likes golf , you could write , “ I hope that your year to come is above par . ”
#Text=If the person likes to play rock music , you could say , “ I hope your day rocks . ”
#Text=If you get stuck for puns , search online to get some inspiration .
#Text=Choosing a Card
#Text=Look for a card with their age if they are celebrating a milestone birthday .
#Text=Most gift stores stock cards with numbers on the front .
#Text=These are especially popular for big birthdays , such as a 1st , 5th , 13th , 16th , 18th , 21st , 30th , 40th , 50th , 60th , 70th , 80th , and 90th .
#Text=If you ca n’t find the right card in store , consider making your own .
#Text=Pick a card that reminds you of the recipient .
#Text=Think about the interests of the person that you are buying the card for .
#Text=For example , if they love animals , consider purchasing an animal card .
#Text=Popular card designs include flowers , cars , movie characters , and sports .
#Text=Purchase cards from a gift store , supermarket , or homeware store .
#Text=Send an eCard if the recipient lives overseas .
#Text=An eCard is a great free way to let someone know that you are thinking about them .
#Text=Search online for an eCard that has a design that you like .
#Text=Type a message to the person and then send it to their email .
#Text=SmileBox , Blue Mountain , and ThousandWordCards are popular eCard vendors .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Do n’t worry about trying to fill the card up with words .
#Text=Simply write what feels meaningful and then sign off .
#Text=Quick Summary
